body: ## Announcements  The center is in a NEW location:  Science Building (LD) Suite 120. For Fall, we are open August 21 - December 15, 2023. We are available by appointment only and cannot take walk-ins. Questions about the center may be emailed to mhcenter@iupui.edu   ## What we do  We serve IUPUI students (undergraduate, professional, and graduate) with clinically significant but less severe/urgent behavioral health and wellness-related needs with individual therapy. We hope to add group therapy in the future.  We also aim to serve IUPUI students who need educational and/or behavioral health assessments. At this time, we are serving IUPUI students only, but hope to expand in the future to serving community members as well.  We are a separate entity from IUPUI CAPS , but work collaboratively with each other to serve students.  [IUPUI CAPS](https://studentaffairs.iupui.edu/health/counseling-psychological/index.html)   ### Our therapists   ### Services provided  See the services and assessments offered at our center.   ### Fee structure  Find information about our fees.   ### People  Learn about our therapists, faculty and staff.   ### Contact us  Get in touch with our center.  We are committed to maintaining an inclusive environment with equitable treatment for all.  As such, we continually strive to create an environment where clients from all backgrounds and identities are celebrated as their authentic selves and given the opportunity to be heard and valued. Our vision is that the Mental Health Center is a space where people of all identities feel welcomed to work and seek help.   #### Phone + Email  317-274-6753 mhcenter@iupui.edu  Need help after hours? Visit our Contact page for crisis phone numbers.   #### Interested in starting services?  Submit a request for services  [Submit a request for services](https://iu.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_82Pgmy1E29WMcYe)   #### Location  Science Building (LD) 402 N. Blackford St. Suite 120 (first floor)   #### Hours  Open Fall & Spring Semesters. Closed Summers.  Monday: 10 a.m. – 5 p.m. Tuesday: 10 a.m. – 5 p.m. Wednesday: 10 a.m. – 5 p.m. Thursday: 10 a.m. – 5 p.m. Friday: 10 a.m. – 1 p.m. Saturday: Closed Sunday: Closed  We are a separate entity from IUPUI CAPS , but work collaboratively with each other to serve students.  [IUPUI CAPS](https://studentaffairs.iupui.edu/health/counseling-psychological/index.html)

The Mental Health Center is located on the first floor of the Science Building (LD) , room 120.  [Science Building (LD)](https://goo.gl/maps/q82DxorPdjq9pUGx9)  The MHC opened its doors to its first clients on August 29, 2022.  The Mental Health Center is an in-house training clinic for the IUPUI Clinical Psychology PhD program. Services are provided by doctoral students from the PhD program in Clinical Psychology at IUPUI. They will be supervised by a licensed clinical psychologist .  We serve IUPUI students (undergraduate, professional, and graduate) with clinically significant but less severe/urgent behavioral health and wellness-related needs with individual and group therapy.  We also aim to serve IUPUI students and community members who need educational and/or behavioral health assessments.   ## Services provided  See the services and assessments offered at our center.   ## Fee structure  Find information about our fees.   ## People  Learn about our therapists, faculty and staff.   ## Contact us  Get in touch with our center.

## Director  Deanna Barthlow-Potkanowicz, Ph.D., HSPP  Deanna Barthlow-Potkanowicz, Ph.D., HSPP, is a licensed psychologist in Ohio and Indiana. She earned her B.A. in psychology at Lycoming College in Williamsport, PA, and her M.A. and Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology at Kent State University. She completed her APA-accredited internship at the Counseling & Testing Center at the University of Oregon.  In graduate school, Deanna’s research focused on personality assessment and test construction, specifically the MMPI-2. After completing her doctorate, she conducted psychological evaluations for the public safety community. She then worked as a staff psychologist and Eating Disorders Treatment Team Coordinator in the campus counseling center at Ohio University. Most recently, she was a tenured Associate Professor of Psychology at Bluffton University in Ohio.  Deanna’s clinical areas of expertise include body image concerns, eating disorders, depression, relationship issues, anxiety, worry, and panic. Additional interests include managing stress, navigating life-transitions, gender roles, working with emerging adults and first-generation college students, and the supervision of psychologists-in-training.   ## Assistant Director  Eduardo F. Salgado, M.S.  Eduardo (Eddie; he/him) is a 5 th year doctoral student in the Clinical Psychology Ph.D. program at IUPUI. He joined the program in 2019 after earning a B.S. in Neuroscience from Duke University. He completed his M.S. in 2021 and continues to work towards completing his Ph.D.  His research interests include understanding how to best engage diverse youth, particularly Hispanic/Latine youth, with psychotherapy services. He is also interested in understanding how certain cultural factors, such as ethnic identity and acculturation, impact relevant mental health and substance use outcomes for these youth. His clinical interests include mood and anxiety disorders, working with youth, and working with diverse clients.   ## Therapists  Therapists at the center are graduate students in the PhD program who are supervised by a licensed clinical psychologist.   ### About us  Learn about our center.   ### Contact us  Get in touch with our center.

## Mental Health Center  Effective: 2022-08-12   ### Overview  At Indiana University (IU), we are committed to protecting the privacy and confidentiality of personal information entrusted to us. By accessing and using IU's services, you acknowledge and consent to the practices described in our global privacy statement here: https://privacy.iu.edu/privacy/global.html .  [https://privacy.iu.edu/privacy/global.html](https://privacy.iu.edu/privacy/global.html)  For additional information outlining how University Information Policy Office collects, uses, and safeguards personal information obtained specifically through our website ( https://datamanagement.iu.edu/ ), please also review the information below.  [https://datamanagement.iu.edu/](https://datamanagement.iu.edu/)  Continued use of our website indicates consent to the collection, use, and disclosure of this information as described in this notice.  Visitors to other IU websites should review the privacy notices for the sites they visit, as other units at the university may collect and use visitor information in different ways. University Information Policy Office is not responsible for the content of other websites or for the privacy practices of websites outside the scope of this notice.   ### Changes  Because Internet technologies continue to evolve rapidly, IUPUI SCHOOL OF SCIENCE may make appropriate changes to this notice in the future.  Any such changes will be consistent with our commitment to respecting visitor privacy, and will be clearly posted in a revised privacy notice.   ### Collection and Use   #### Passive/Automatic Collection  When you view pages on our site, the web server automatically collects certain technical information from your computer and about your connection. This information is outlined in the IU Privacy statement.  [IU Privacy statement.](https://privacy.iu.edu/privacy/global.html)   #### Active/Manual/Voluntary Collection  We will not attempt to collect any information from you through the use of forms or other type of manual input.   #### Information Sharing  Except as described in the IU Privacy statement , we will not share any information with any other entities or organizations for any reason.  [IU Privacy statement](https://privacy.iu.edu/privacy/global.html)  Except as provided in the Disclosure of Information section below, we do not attempt to use the technical information discussed in this section to identify individual visitors.   #### Cookies  For more information on how we use cookies, please review the IU Privacy statement .  [IU Privacy statement](https://privacy.iu.edu/privacy/global.html)   #### Use of Third Party Services  Our website does not utilize web analytics services beyond what is noted in the IU Privacy statement .  [IU Privacy statement](https://privacy.iu.edu/privacy/global.html)   ### Security  Due to the rapidly evolving nature of information technologies, no transmission of information over the Internet can be guaranteed to be completely secure. While Indiana University is committed to protecting user privacy, IU cannot guarantee the security of any information users transmit to university sites, and users do so at their own risk.   ### Links to non-university sites  Indiana University is not responsible for the availability, content, or privacy practices of non-university sites. Non-university sites are not bound by this site privacy notice policy and may or may not have their own privacy policies.   ### Privacy Notice Changes  From time to time, we may use visitor information for new, unanticipated uses not previously disclosed in our privacy notice.   ### Contact Information  If you have questions or concerns about this policy, please contact us.  Mental Health Center ATTN: Web Administrator sosweb@iupui.edu  If you feel that this site is not following its stated policy and communicating with the owner of this site does not resolve the matter, or if you have general questions or concerns about privacy or information technology policy at Indiana University, please contact the chief privacy officer through the University Information Policy Office, 812-855-UIPO, privacy@iu.edu .

Phone 317-274-6753  Email mhcenter@iupui.edu  Location Science Building (LD) 402 N. Blackford St. Suite 120 (first floor)  Hours  Open Fall and Spring semesters. Closed Summers.  Monday: 10 a.m. – 5 p.m. Tuesday: 10 a.m. – 5 p.m. Wednesday: 10 a.m. – 5 p.m. Thursday: 10 a.m. – 5 p.m. Friday: 10 a.m. – 1 p.m. Saturday: Closed Sunday: Closed     ## Interested in starting services?  Submit a request for services  [Submit a request for services](https://iu.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_82Pgmy1E29WMcYe)  We are a separate entity from IUPUI CAPS , but work collaboratively with each other to serve students.  [IUPUI CAPS](https://studentaffairs.iupui.edu/health/counseling-psychological/index.html)   ## Need help when we are closed?  We do not monitor our phone or email when we are closed. If you have an emergency after business hours, please use one of these 24-hour crisis hotlines or call the Indiana University Police Department at 911 or 317-274-7911.  Local Crisis & Suicide Hotline: 317-251-7575 Aspire: 800-560-4038  National Suicide and Crisis Lifeline: 988                                                                           National Hopeline Network: 1-800-422-HOPE (4673) National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-TALK (8255) The Trevor Lifeline: 866-488-7386     ### About us  Learn about our center.   ### People  Learn about our therapists, faculty and staff.

## Individual therapy  Individual counseling is free for up to 6 sessions for IUPUI students.   ## Assessments  Assessments will be charged fees, depending on the length and complexity, ranging from $300-600.   ### Services provided  See the services and assessments offered at our center.   ### Contact us  Get in touch with our center.
